arts.ttl: Robbie Brady explains muted celebration against former side Burnley during Preston's FA Cup win
arts.sum: Robbie Brady came back to haunt his former club Burnley on Saturday when he opened the scoring with a fine free-kick for Preston North End.

arts.ttl: Burnley players ignore Osmajic after racial abuse accusations
arts.sum: Burnley players refuse to shake Milutin Osmajic's hand after teammate Hannibal Mejbri accused the Preston forward of racially abusing him the last time the two sides met.

arts.ttl: Paul Heckingbottom's verdict on Preston North End's 'frantic' FA Cup win against Burnley
arts.sum: Paul Heckingbottom felt his Preston North End side were good value for their FA Cup fifth round win against Burnley.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker on Burnley's FA Cup defeat to Preston North End and his decision to make changes
arts.sum: Scott Parker accepts his Burnley side “fell short” during their chastening FA Cup defeat to Preston North End – but defended his decision to change up his side.

arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Preston North End as 5/10s dished out after miserable display - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley endured a miserable afternoon at the office as their Lancashire rivals Preston North End dumped them out of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Burnley players refuse to shake hands with Preston’s Milutin Osmajic before FA Cup tie
arts.sum: The two sides were facing off less than a fortnight after Burnley’s Hannibal Mejbri had accused Preston forward Milutin Osmajic of racial abuse

arts.ttl: Preston end Burnley's unbeaten run to reach quarter-finals
arts.sum: Preston North End beat Lancashire rivals Burnley comfortably in the 5th round of the FA Cup at the Deepdale stadium.

arts.ttl: Preston’s Milutin Osmajic riles Burnley with Cup goal taunts after racism claim
arts.sum: “Preston advance to the FA Cup quarter-finals,” proclaimed the PA announcer at Deepdale. It is a sentence no Preston fan has heard since 1966 but a reality after Paul Heckingbottom’s team produced a dominant display to shred Burnley. Milutin Osmajic, almost inevitably, was central to Preston’s passage into the last eight. Robbie Brady, with a superb free-kick, Osmajic, with a clinical strike, and a predatory finish from Will Keane gave the hosts victory in the meeting of two founder members of the Football League. Burnley’s previously mean and lauded defence was nowhere to be seen. Defeat could have been greater for Scott Parker’s side. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Burnley blank Preston striker amid racism row
arts.sum: Burnley players refused to shake hands with Preston North-End defender Milutin Osmajic during their FA Cup fifth round clash on Saturday as a sign of solidarity with teammate Hannibal Mejbri.

arts.ttl: FA Cup drama as Burnley stars refuse to shake hands with rival after alleged racist abuse
arts.sum: Burnley players showed their solidarity with Hannibal Mejbri by collectively pulling their hands away from Milutin Osmajic as both teams went through their pre-match formalities ahead of their Cup tie
